sentences.en: A lack of magnesium causes muscles to go into spasm.
A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack.
sentences.cn: 冠状动脉的肌肉痉挛可能导致心脏病。

sentences.en: A spasm of pain brought his thoughts back to the present.
sentences.cn: 一阵剧痛把他的思绪拉回到了现在。

sentences.en: Again a spasm of longing and remorse throbbed through Ashurst.
sentences.cn: 艾舍斯特心头又激动起一阵渴望和悔恨.

sentences.en: He felt a spasm of panic sweeping over him.
sentences.cn: 他感到一阵恐慌传遍全身.

sentences.en: He kicked the chair in a spasm of impatience.
sentences.cn: 他突然变得不耐烦,一脚踢向椅子.

sentences.en: If breathing is not restored, the patient may go into spasm.
sentences.cn: 如果不能恢复呼吸, 这个病人就会发生抽搐.

sentences.en: Kemp felt a spasm of fear.
sentences.cn: 肯普突然感到一阵恐惧。

sentences.en: Maggie felt a muscle spasm in her back.
sentences.cn: 玛吉觉得背部肌肉一阵抽搐。

sentences.en: She could not speak; her throat was in spasm.
sentences.cn: 她喉咙抽搐着,说不出话来.

sentences.en: The child in a spasm kept twitching his arms and legs.
sentences.cn: 那个害痉挛的孩子四肢不断地抽搐.

sentences.en: The injection sent his leg into spasm .
sentences.cn: 一针打下去，他的腿就痉挛了。

sentences.en: Then the end of the Korean War produced another spasm of reappraisal.
sentences.cn: 后来,朝鲜战争的结束引起了又一次重新评价的热潮.

sentences.en: Then the spasm passed, leaving a dull ache behind.
sentences.cn: 接着肚痛过去了, 只留下一阵麻木的感觉.

sentences.en: There was another spasm in his entrails, the heavy boots were approaching.
sentences.cn: 他的五脏六腑又是一阵痉挛; 皮靴咔嚓声又走近了.

sentences.en: Tom’s jaw muscles had gone into spasm .
sentences.cn: 汤姆的颌部肌肉开始抽搐。

sentences.en: When the spasm passed, it left him weak and sweating.
sentences.cn: 一阵痉挛之后, 他虚弱无力,一直冒汗.

words.tran_cn: 痉挛的，痉挛性的；间歇性的
断续性地；发作性地；痉挛性地
强直状态，[临床] 痉挛状态

trans.tran_cn: 痉挛，抽搐，（能量、行为等的）突发，发作
trans.tran_en: an occasion when your muscles suddenly become tight, causing you pain
